ref: 3474 kḗsara n. ʻ hair (of brow) ʼ VS., ʻ hair ʼ ŚBr., ʻ mane, filament of lotus and other plants ʼ R., ʻ fibre (of mango) ʼ Suśr.
Pa. kēsara -- in cmpd. ʻ mane ʼ, n. ʻ filament of flowers and plants (e
Pk. kēsara -- m.n. ʻ mane of lion etc., filament of flower ʼ, m. ʻ the tree Mimusops elengi ʼ;
Pk. kēsara -- m.n. ʻ mane of lion etc., filament of flower ʼ, m. ʻ the tree Mimusops elengi ʼ;
N. kesar ʻ saffron ʼ, kesro ʻ a piece cut off a fruit ʼ;
H. kesar m. ʻ Crocus sativus, Rottlera tinctoria, Mesua ferrea ʼ;
M. kẽsar n. ʻ any compound flower, a straw, a hair ʼ;
Si. kesara ʻ stamens of flowers, hair on body, mane ʼ, kesuru ʻ Mimusops elengi ʼ.
